content:
TITLE: Model Input with Two-way Binding DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement a model input that supports two-way binding and value updates. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/inputs.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Component({ /* ... */}) export class CustomSlider { // Define a model input named "value". value = model(0); increment() { // Update the model input with a new value, propagating the value to any bindings. this.value.update(oldValue => oldValue + 10); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating a FormControl Value Dynamically in Angular DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the setValue() method to dynamically update a FormControl value, for example, from a service or API response, replacing the old value in Angular. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/reactive-forms.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TestBed for HttpClient Testing - Angular - TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Sets up the Angular TestBed for testing HttpClient requests with a mock backend. The snippet requires importing provideHttpClient and provideHttpClientTesting and injecting HttpTestingController from TestBed. Expected input is a request made by the HttpClient in the application. Outputs mock responses and allows request verifications. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/http/testing.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: TypeScript CODE: ``` TestBed.configureTestingModule({ providers: [ // ... other test providers provideHttpClient(), provideHttpClientTesting(), ], }); const httpTesting = TestBed.inject(HttpTestingController); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Angular CLI with Different Package Managers DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing the Angular CLI globally using different package managers including npm, pnpm, yarn, and bun. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/introduction/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm install -g @angular/cli ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` pnpm install -g @angular/cli ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` yarn global add @angular/cli ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` bun install -g @angular/cli ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Functional Interceptors - Angular HttpClient - TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Shows how to register one or more functional HTTP interceptors with Angular's HttpClient, using the withInterceptors helper function during application bootstrap. Dependencies include Angular's provideHttpClient and withInterceptors. Interceptors are applied in the order listed. The providers array should include all desired interceptors. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/http/interceptors.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: TypeScript CODE: ``` bootstrapApplication(AppComponent, {providers: [\n provideHttpClient(\n withInterceptors([loggingInterceptor, cachingInterceptor]),\n )\n]}); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting a Writable Signal's Value in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Shows how to directly set the value of a writable signal using the '.set()' method. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/signals/overview.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` count.set(3); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing Component with Manual Change Detection DESCRIPTION: Test that correctly verifies component binding by manually triggering change detection with fixture.detectChanges() before checking expectations. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/testing/components-scenarios.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` it('should display original title after detectChanges()', () => { fixture.detectChanges(); expect(h1.textContent).toContain(component.title); }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Injectable Service in Angular DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript code demonstrates how to create a service in Angular that can be injected using dependency injection. The @Injectable decorator is applied to a class to make it available for injection throughout the application. The providedIn property is set to 'root', making the service available at the application level. This pattern is essential for managing data and interactions with APIs in a reusable manner across the Angular application. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/tutorials/learn-angular/steps/19-creating-an-injectable-service/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Injectable({ providedIn: 'root' }) class UserService { // methods to retrieve and return data } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Providing HeroService at the Root Level DESCRIPTION: Specifies that `HeroService` should be available at the root level by using `providedIn: 'root'` in the `@Injectable` decorator. This approach allows Angular to perform tree-shaking, optimizing the code by removing unused services. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/di/dependency-injection.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Injectable({\n providedIn: 'root'\n})\nclass HeroService {} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a New Angular Project DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new Angular project using the Angular CLI. Replace with your desired project name. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/introduction/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` ng new ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Required Input Property Declaration DESCRIPTION: Shows how to declare a required input property using input.required(). SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/inputs.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Component({/*...*/}) export class CustomSlider { // Declare a required input named value. Returns an `InputSignal`. value = input.required(); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Components in Angular DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to import and use other components within a component. The imports array in the @Component decorator makes the ProfilePhoto component available for use in the template. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/anatomy-of-components.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: angular-ts CODE: ``` import {ProfilePhoto} from './profile-photo'; @Component({ // Import the `ProfilePhoto` component in // order to use it in this component's template. imports: [ProfilePhoto], /* ... */ }) export class UserProfile { } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Validation Errors in Angular Template-Driven Forms (HTML) DESCRIPTION: Shows how to display validation error messages in an Angular template-driven form. It uses the `ngModel` export (`#name="ngModel"`) to check the control's `valid`, `dirty`, and `touched` states. Standard HTML attributes (`required`, `minlength`) and a custom validator directive (`forbiddenName`) are applied. Error messages for `required`, `minlength`, and `forbiddenName` are conditionally displayed using `*ngIf` based on the control's validity and interaction state (dirty or touched). SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/form-validation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
Name is required.
Name must be at least 4 characters long.
Name cannot be Bob.
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Input Required in Angular DESCRIPTION: Introduces a class in Angular with a simple configuration of required inputs, focusing on string input management. A straightforward illustration of using input.required to enforce input constraints. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/core/schematics/migrations/signal-migration/test/golden_best_effort.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` // tslint:disable import {input} from '@angular/core'; class Required { readonly simpleInput = input.required(); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating a Writable Signal's Value in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to update a writable signal's value based on its previous value using the '.update()' method. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/signals/overview.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` // Increment the count by 1. count.update(value => value + 1); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Reusable User Service with HttpClient in Angular DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a reusable, injectable UserService that encapsulates data access logic for fetching user data using HttpClient in Angular. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/http/making-requests.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Injectable({providedIn: 'root'}) export class UserService { private http = inject(HttpClient); getUser(id: string): Observable { return this.http.get(`/api/user/${id}`); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating and serving a new Angular project DESCRIPTION: Sequence of commands to create a new Angular project, navigate into the project directory, and serve the application locally. This launches a development server at http://localhost:4200/. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/cli/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` ng new my-first-project cd my-first-project ng serve ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Assets in Angular CLI Build DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure asset paths in the Angular CLI build configuration. It shows the default asset configuration and how to exclude specific file types. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/reference/configs/workspace-config.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "projects": { "my-app": { "architect": { "build": { "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:application", "options": { "assets": [ { "glob": "**/*", "input": "src/assets/", "output": "/assets/" }, { "glob": "favicon.ico", "input": "src/", "output": "/" } ] } } } } } } ``` LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "projects": { "my-app": { "architect": { "build": { "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:application", "options": { "assets": [ { "glob": "**/*", "input": "src/assets/", "ignore": ["**/*.svg"], "output": "/assets/" } ] } } } } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Nested FormGroup in Angular Component - TypeScript DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript snippet illustrates how to create a nested FormGroup in the ProfileEditor component. It includes form controls for address information, demonstrating the composition of complex form groups. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/reactive-forms.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { FormGroup, FormControl } from '@angular/forms'; export class ProfileEditorComponent { profileForm = new FormGroup({ firstName: new FormControl(''), lastName: new FormControl(''), address: new FormGroup({ street: new FormControl(''), city: new FormControl(''), state: new FormControl(''), zip: new FormControl('') }) }); onSubmit() { // TODO: Use EventEmitter with form value console.warn(this.profileForm.value); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Injecting HttpClient into an Angular Service (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to inject the configured `HttpClient` service into an Angular service (`ConfigService`) using the `inject` function within the service class. The injected `http` property can then be used to make HTTP requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/http/setup.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Injectable({providedIn: 'root'}) export class ConfigService { private http = inject(HttpClient); // This service can now make HTTP requests via `this.http`. } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining a Logging Interceptor - Angular HttpClient - TypeScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet declares a simple functional HTTP interceptor in Angular that logs the outgoing request URL using console.log, then forwards the request to the next handler. It requires Angular's HttpClient, HttpRequest, and HttpHandlerFn, returning an Observable. Parameters include the outgoing request and the handler function. The output is an Observable stream of HTTP events, unchanged except for the logging side-effect. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/http/interceptors.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: TypeScript CODE: ``` export function loggingInterceptor(req: HttpRequest, next: HttpHandlerFn): Observable> {\n console.log(req.url);\n return next(req);\n} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Self Modifier with Constructor Injection in Angular DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates modifying constructor injection with `@Self()` and `@Optional()` to optionally inject `LeafService` only from the current `ElementInjector`. Dependencies: `LeafService`. Inputs: None. Outputs: Injected `LeafService` or `undefined`. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/di/hierarchical-dependency-injection.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` export class SelfNoDataComponent { constructor(@Self() @Optional() public leaf?: LeafService) { } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding a Required Input Property to an Angular Directive (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Illustrates adding a required input property named `selectFrom` to the `SelectDirective` using the `@Input()` decorator. The `required: true` option ensures this input must be provided when using the directive. The input is typed as `DataSource` (assumed to be defined elsewhere) and is prefixed with `select` to align with the directive's selector for shorthand syntax usage. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/directives/structural-directives.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ts CODE: ``` export class SelectDirective { // ... @Input({required: true}) selectFrom!: DataSource; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Component Level Service Provisioning DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to provide the `HeroService` at the component level using the `providers` field in the `@Component` decorator. Each instance of the `HeroListComponent` will have its own instance of `HeroService`. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/di/dependency-injection.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Component({\n selector: 'hero-list',\n template: '...',\n providers: [HeroService]\n})\nclass HeroListComponent {} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Providing HttpClient in Standalone Angular Apps (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to provide the `HttpClient` service in a standalone Angular application using the `provideHttpClient` function within the `providers` array of the `ApplicationConfig` in `app.config.ts`. This makes `HttpClient` available for dependency injection throughout the application. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/http/setup.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` export const appConfig: ApplicationConfig = { providers: [ provideHttpClient(), ] }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Providing DI-Based Interceptors with withInterceptorsFromDi - Angular HttpClient - TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Shows how to enable DI-based interceptors in Angular's provider configuration by using withInterceptorsFromDi() and registering the interceptor with the HTTP_INTERCEPTORS multi-provider. Multiple interceptors can be registered in this manner. Requires Angular's DI system, HttpClient, and the custom interceptor class. Providers must specify multi: true. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/http/interceptors.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: TypeScript CODE: ``` bootstrapApplication(AppComponent, {providers: [\n provideHttpClient(\n // DI-based interceptors must be explicitly enabled.\n withInterceptorsFromDi(),\n ),\n\n {provide: HTTP_INTERCEPTORS, useClass: LoggingInterceptor, multi: true},\n]}); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Template Nested FormGroup Binding in Angular - HTML DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet binds a nested FormGroup instance representing address information to input elements in an Angular template. It makes use of formGroupName and formControlName directives to manage nested form data. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/reactive-forms.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Subscribing to Outputs Programmatically in Angular TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Shows how to programmatically subscribe to output events when creating components dynamically using the subscribe method. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/outputs.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` const someComponentRef: ComponentRef = viewContainerRef.createComponent(/*...*/); someComponentRef.instance.someEventProperty.subscribe(eventData => { console.log(eventData); }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining and Using Inputs in Angular Component - TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a comprehensive Angular component utilizing the input utility with generics, transformation functions, and control flow patterns. Includes migration comments for accessor inputs and input property writes, along with several methods to test input accesses, type narrowing, and integration with inheritance types. Dependencies are Angular's Component and Input decorators, and the custom input function. Inputs have various types, with example transformations and access patterns tested through methods and helper functions. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/core/schematics/migrations/signal-migration/test/golden.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` // tslint:disable import {Component, Input, input} from '@angular/core'; interface Vehicle {} interface Car extends Vehicle { __car: true; } interface Audi extends Car { __audi: true; } @Component({ selector: 'app-component', templateUrl: './template.html', }) export class AppComponent { readonly input = input(null); readonly bla = input.required({ transform: disabledTransform }); readonly narrowableMultipleTimes = input(null); readonly withUndefinedInput = input(); // TODO: Skipped for migration because: // Your application code writes to the input. This prevents migration. @Input() incompatible: string | null = null; private _bla: any; // TODO: Skipped for migration because: // Accessor inputs cannot be migrated as they are too complex. @Input() set ngSwitch(newValue: any) { this._bla = newValue; if (newValue === 0) { console.log('test'); } } someControlFlowCase() { const input = this.input(); if (input) { input.charAt(0); } } moreComplexControlFlowCase() { const input = this.input(); if (!input) { return; } this.doSomething(); (() => { // might be a different input value now?! // No! it can't because we don't allow writes to "input"!!. console.log(input.substring(0)); })(); } doSomething() { this.incompatible = 'some other value'; } vsd() { const input = this.input(); const narrowableMultipleTimes = this.narrowableMultipleTimes(); if (!input && narrowableMultipleTimes !== null) { return narrowableMultipleTimes; } return input ? 'eager' : 'lazy'; } allTheSameNoNarrowing() { const input = this.input(); console.log(input); console.log(input); } test() { if (this.narrowableMultipleTimes()) { console.log(); const x = () => { // @ts-expect-error if (isCar(this.narrowableMultipleTimes())) { } }; console.log(); console.log(); x(); x(); } } extremeNarrowingNested() { const narrowableMultipleTimes = this.narrowableMultipleTimes(); if (narrowableMultipleTimes && isCar(narrowableMultipleTimes)) { narrowableMultipleTimes.__car; let car = narrowableMultipleTimes; let ctx = this; function nestedFn() { if (isAudi(car)) { console.log(car.__audi); } const narrowableMultipleTimesValue = ctx.narrowableMultipleTimes(); if (!isCar(narrowableMultipleTimesValue!) || !isAudi(narrowableMultipleTimesValue)) { return; } narrowableMultipleTimesValue.__audi; } // iife (() => { if (isAudi(narrowableMultipleTimes)) { narrowableMultipleTimes.__audi; } })(); } } } function disabledTransform(bla: string | boolean): boolean { return true; } function isCar(v: Vehicle): v is Car { return true; } function isAudi(v: Car): v is Audi { return true; } const x: AppComponent = null!; x.incompatible = null; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Injecting Services into Angular Components - TypeScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to inject a service into an Angular component using constructor-based dependency injection. The `PetCareService` is injected into the `PetCarDashboardComponent` by specifying it as a private parameter in the constructor. This makes `petCareService` readily accessible within the component. Understanding this approach facilitates better management of resources in Angular applications. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/tutorials/learn-angular/steps/21-constructor-based-di/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: TypeScript CODE: ``` @Component({...}) class PetCarDashboardComponent { constructor(private petCareService: PetCareService) { ... } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing Async Observable with async/await in Angular DESCRIPTION: Shows how to test an asynchronous observable using async/await syntax in an Angular component test. It demonstrates waiting for stability and asserting results. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/testing/components-scenarios.md#2025-04-23_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: TypeScript CODE: ``` it('should show quote after getQuote (async)', async () => { fixture.detectChanges(); expect(quoteEl.textContent).toBe('...'); await fixture.whenStable(); fixture.detectChanges(); expect(quoteEl.textContent).toBe(testQuote); }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Programmatic Navigation using router.navigateByUrl() with URL Strings in Angular DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the `router.navigateByUrl()` method for programmatic navigation by providing a single URL path string. This is useful for absolute navigation or when dealing with pre-constructed URL strings. Examples cover standard routes, nested routes, routes with parameters/fragments, and routes with query parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/routing/navigate-to-routes.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: angular-ts CODE: ``` // Standard route navigation router.navigateByUrl('/products); // Navigate to nested route router.navigateByUrl('/products/featured'); // Complete URL with parameters and fragment router.navigateByUrl('/products/123?view=details#reviews'); // Navigate with query parameters router.navigateByUrl('/search?category=books&sortBy=price'); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing NgClass Directive in Angular Component (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Shows how to import the `NgClass` directive from `@angular/common` into the `imports` array of an Angular standalone component. This makes the `NgClass` directive available for use within the component's template for dynamically managing CSS classes. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/directives/overview.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { NgClass } from '@angular/common'; // ... other imports @Component({ selector: 'app-root', standalone: true, imports: [ NgClass, // Make NgClass available // ... other imports ], templateUrl: './app.component.html', styleUrls: ['./app.component.css'], }) export class AppComponent { // ... component logic } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking if a Value is a Signal in Angular DESCRIPTION: The isSignal function determines if a given value is an Angular Signal object, which is part of Angular's reactive primitives system. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/goldens/public-api/core/index.api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` export function isSignal(value: unknown): value is Signal; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching Data Based on Route Parameter in Angular Component (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Updates the `DetailsComponent` class (`src/app/details/details.component.ts`) to fetch and handle housing location data. It injects `HousingService` alongside `ActivatedRoute`. The constructor now retrieves the `id` from the route parameter, converts it to a number, and then calls `housingService.getHousingLocationById()` with this ID. The result (the specific `HousingLocation` data) is assigned to the `housingLocation` property, making it available to the template. The `HousingLocation` interface defines the expected structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/tutorials/first-app/steps/11-details-page/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` export class DetailsComponent { route: ActivatedRoute = inject(ActivatedRoute); housingService = inject(HousingService); housingLocation: HousingLocation | undefined; constructor() { const housingLocationId = Number(this.route.snapshot.params['id']); this.housingLocation = this.housingService.getHousingLocationById(housingLocationId); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Demonstrating Supported Operators in Angular Expressions DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates various supported operators in Angular expressions, including arithmetic, comparison, logical, and special operators like pipes and optional chaining. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/templates/expression-syntax.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: JavaScript CODE: ``` "1 + 2" // Addition "52 - 3" // Subtraction "41 * 6" // Multiplication "20 / 4" // Division "17 % 5" // Remainder "10 ** 3" // Exponentiation "9 * (8 + 4)" // Parenthesis "a > b ? true : false" // Conditional "&& || !" // Logical operators "possiblyNullValue ?? 'default'" // Nullish coalescing "< <= > >= == === !==" // Comparison operators "-x" // Unary negation "+y" // Unary plus "person['name']" // Property accessor "{{ total | currency }}" // Pipe operator "someObj.someProp?.nestedProp" // Optional chaining "someObj!.someProp" // Non-null assertion (TypeScript) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TestBed with Auto Change Detection DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring the Angular TestBed to use automatic change detection by providing the ComponentFixtureAutoDetect provider in the testing module. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/testing/components-scenarios.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` TestBed.configureTestingModule({ declarations: [ BannerComponent ], providers: [ { provide: ComponentFixtureAutoDetect, useValue: true } ] }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Dynamically Rendering Components with NgComponentOutlet in Angular DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use NgComponentOutlet to dynamically render either an AdminBio or StandardBio component based on the user's admin status. It utilizes a method to determine which component to render. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/programmatic-rendering.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Component({ ... }) export class AdminBio { /* ... */ } @Component({ ... }) export class StandardBio { /* ... */ } @Component({ ..., template: `

Profile for {{user.name}}

` }) export class CustomDialog { @Input() user: User; getBioComponent() { return this.user.isAdmin ? AdminBio : StandardBio; } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining FormGroup for Application Form in TypeScript Component DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript snippet defines a `FormGroup` named `applyForm` within the `DetailsComponent` class. It structures the form using `FormControl` instances for 'firstName', 'lastName', and 'email', initializing each with an empty string as the default value. This sets up the model for the reactive form. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/tutorials/first-app/steps/12-forms/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: TypeScript CODE: ``` // In src/app/details/details.component.ts, inside DetailsComponent class: applyForm = new FormGroup({ firstName: new FormControl(''), lastName: new FormControl(''), email: new FormControl('') }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing NgIf Directive in Angular Component (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Shows how to import the `NgIf` directive from `@angular/common` into the `imports` array of an Angular standalone component. This allows the use of the `*ngIf` structural directive in the component's template to conditionally add or remove elements from the DOM. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/directives/overview.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { NgIf } from '@angular/common'; // Import NgIf // ... other imports @Component({ selector: 'app-root', standalone: true, imports: [ NgIf, // Make NgIf available // ... other imports ], templateUrl: './app.component.html', styleUrls: ['./app.component.css'], }) export class AppComponent { isActive = true; // Example property for NgIf condition // ... component logic } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Custom Providers Using InjectionToken in Angular (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create a custom InjectionToken to inject browser APIs, such as localStorage, into Angular services. It defines an InjectionToken named BROWSER_STORAGE, which is provided in the root injector with a factory returning localStorage, allowing BrowserStorageService to consume this dependency. Key parameters include the token name and the factory function; the service provides get and set wrappers for interacting with localStorage. This pattern enables easy mocking of browser APIs during testing and supports strong typing and dependency inversion. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/di/di-in-action.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { Inject, Injectable, InjectionToken } from '@angular/core';\n\nexport const BROWSER_STORAGE = new InjectionToken('Browser Storage', {\n providedIn: 'root',\n factory: () => localStorage\n});\n\n@Injectable({\n providedIn: 'root'\n})\nexport class BrowserStorageService {\n public storage = inject(BROWSER_STORAGE);\n\n get(key: string) {\n return this.storage.getItem(key);\n }\n\n set(key: string, value: string) {\n this.storage.setItem(key, value);\n }\n} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Aliases with @Output Decorator in Angular TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to specify a different name for an event in a template by passing a parameter to the @Output decorator. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/outputs.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Component({/*...*/}) export class CustomSlider { @Output('valueChanged') changed = new EventEmitter(); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Angular Router to an Existing Project using Angular CLI (Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command uses the Angular CLI (`ng`) to add the official Angular Router (`@angular/router`) package to an existing Angular project that was not initially set up with routing. It requires the Angular CLI to be installed and automatically installs the necessary dependencies and performs initial configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/routing/overview.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ng add @angular/router ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updated Rendered Output After Value Change DESCRIPTION: This shows how Angular automatically updates the rendered content when the bound expression value changes from 'dark' to 'light'. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/templates/binding.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: angular-html CODE: ```

Your color preference is light.

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Up Route-Level Providers for Dependency Injection in Angular DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to provide dependencies to a specific route via dependency injection. The example creates an admin section with its own service and API key that are only available to components within that route hierarchy. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/routing/define-routes.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` export const ROUTES: Route[] = [ { path: 'admin', providers: [ AdminService, {provide: ADMIN_API_KEY, useValue: '12345'}, ], children: [ {path: 'users', component: AdminUsersComponent}, {path: 'teams', component: AdminTeamsComponent}, ], }, // ... other application routes that don't // have access to ADMIN_API_KEY or AdminService. ]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Input Property in Angular Component Template - Angular with TypeScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides the Angular template for the UserComponent, showing how to interpolate (display) the value of the 'occupation' property received via @Input. The template uses Angular's interpolation syntax to render the input property inside a paragraph element. It requires the property 'occupation' be defined on the UserComponent class and is intended to be used for user-facing displays of data passed in from the parent. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/tutorials/learn-angular/steps/8-input/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: angular-ts CODE: ``` @Component({ ... template: `

The user's occupation is {{occupation}}

` }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Required Field Validation Implementation DESCRIPTION: Adding required validator to firstName field using Validators.required SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/reactive-forms.md#2025-04-22_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` firstName: ['', Validators.required] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing a Typed FormGroup with Non-Nullable Controls (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Creates a `FormGroup` for a login form where both 'email' and 'password' controls are explicitly marked as non-nullable using `{nonNullable: true}`. The group's value type will be `Partial<{email: string, password: string}>` because controls can be disabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/typed-forms.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` ```ts const login = new FormGroup({ email: new FormControl('', {nonNullable: true}), password: new FormControl('', {nonNullable: true}), }); ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Breaking Circular References Using forwardRef in Angular Providers (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: This snippet exemplifies the use of Angular's forwardRef utility to resolve circular dependencies in provider definitions. The providers array uses provide and useExisting to register a dependency on PARENT_MENU_ITEM, referencing the MenuItem class with forwardRef to defer its evaluation until the class is defined. This approach is essential when the target class is not yet declared due to the file's declaration order, preventing reference errors in complex provider configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/di/di-in-action.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` providers: [\n {\n provide: PARENT_MENU_ITEM,\n useExisting: forwardRef(() => MenuItem),\n },\n], ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Providing ENVIRONMENT_INITIALIZER in Angular DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the correct way to provide the ENVIRONMENT_INITIALIZER token with multi: true. This ensures that the token is provided as an array, which is required for multi providers in Angular. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/reference/errors/NG0209.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` {provide: ENVIRONMENT_INITIALIZER, multi: true, useValue: () => {...}} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining CommonModule in Angular Common DESCRIPTION: Definition of the CommonModule that provides common directives and pipes like NgIf, NgForOf, DecimalPipe, etc. This is the module that most Angular applications will import. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/goldens/public-api/common/index.api.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` // @public export class CommonModule { // (undocumented) static ɵfac: i0.ɵɵFactoryDeclaration; // (undocumented) static ɵinj: i0.ɵɵInjectorDeclaration; // (undocumented) static ɵmod: i0.ɵɵNgModuleDeclaration; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reading Input Values with Computed Properties DESCRIPTION: Shows how to read input values using computed properties in an Angular component. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/inputs.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import {Component, input} from '@angular/core'; @Component({/*...*/}) export class CustomSlider { // Declare an input named 'value' with a default value of zero. value = input(0); // Create a computed expression that reads the value input label = computed(() => `The slider's value is ${this.value()}`); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating an Effect in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create an effect that runs when signal values change using the 'effect' function. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/signals/overview.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` effect(() => { console.log(`The current count is: ${count()}`); }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Visualizing Angular Lifecycle Hook Execution Order During Updates (Mermaid) DESCRIPTION: This Mermaid diagram depicts the execution order of Angular lifecycle hooks during subsequent updates triggered by change detection after the initial rendering. It highlights the hooks involved in updates (`ngOnChanges`, `ngDoCheck`, `ngAfterContentChecked`, `ngAfterViewChecked`) followed by the rendering phase (`afterRender`). SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/lifecycle.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: mermaid CODE: ``` ```mermaid graph TD; subgraph CHANGE [Change detection] direction TB ngOnChanges-->ngDoCheck ngDoCheck-->ngAfterContentChecked; ngDoCheck-->ngAfterViewChecked end CHANGE--Rendering-->afterRender ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Dynamic Text Binding in Angular Components DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use interpolation binding with double curly braces to display dynamic text from a component's signal. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/introduction/essentials/templates.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: angular-ts CODE: ``` @Component({ selector: 'user-profile', template: `

Profile for {{userName()}}

`, }) export class TodoListItem { userName = signal('pro_programmer_123'); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Components in Templates DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use one component inside another by including its selector as an HTML element. This example shows ProfilePhoto being used within the UserProfile component. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/anatomy-of-components.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: angular-ts CODE: ``` @Component({ selector: 'profile-photo', }) export class ProfilePhoto { } @Component({ imports: [ProfilePhoto], template: `` }) export class UserProfile { } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Component to Render Individual Dynamic Form Questions in Angular DESCRIPTION: Defines the `DynamicFormQuestionComponent` (TypeScript logic and HTML template) responsible for rendering a single question within the dynamic form. The template uses an `ngSwitch` based on the question's `controlType` to display the appropriate HTML input element (textbox or dropdown) and binds it to the corresponding `FormControl` within the parent `FormGroup` using `formControlName`. It also displays validation errors. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/dynamic-forms.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ```
{{question.label}} is required
``` LANGUAGE: TypeScript CODE: ``` import { Component, Input } from '@angular/core'; import { FormGroup } from '@angular/forms'; import { QuestionBase } from './question-base'; @Component({ selector: 'app-question', templateUrl: './dynamic-form-question.component.html' }) export class DynamicFormQuestionComponent { @Input() question!: QuestionBase; @Input() form!: FormGroup; get isValid() { return this.form.controls[this.question.key].valid; } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing a Page Object for Angular Component Testing DESCRIPTION: This code creates a Page class to encapsulate component DOM manipulation and testing logic for HeroDetailComponent. It provides methods to query elements, check visibility status, and simulate user events like clicking buttons or typing in inputs. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/testing/components-scenarios.md#2025-04-23_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` class Page { // get the hero component title get title() { return this.fixture.nativeElement.querySelector('h2').textContent; } // get the hero name input box get nameInput() { return this.fixture.nativeElement.querySelector('input'); } // get the hero name from the input box get nameDisplay() { return this.nameInput.value; } get saveBtn() { return this.fixture.nativeElement.querySelector('button[type=button]'); } get cancelBtn() { return this.fixture.nativeElement.querySelectorAll('button')[1]; } constructor(private fixture: ComponentFixture) { } //// query for the DOM elements // Clicking the buttons doesn't do anything in this faked version // In a real app, it would save or cancel and navigate back to the list clickSave() { this.saveBtn.click(); } clickCancel() { this.cancelBtn.click(); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Injecting Configuration Using InjectionToken in Angular (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Shows how to inject a value provided via an InjectionToken inside a component's constructor using Angular's 'inject' function. The injected value is used to set a component property (e.g., 'title'). Requires that 'APP_CONFIG' provider is registered, and demonstrates extracting runtime config in constructors. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/di/dependency-injection-providers.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` export class AppComponent { constructor() { const config = inject(APP_CONFIG); this.title = config.title; } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using DestroyRef in Angular Component DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to use DestroyRef as an alternative to ngOnDestroy for handling component destruction cleanup. Shows how to register a callback that executes when the component is destroyed. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/lifecycle.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Component({ /* ... */ }) export class UserProfile { constructor() { inject(DestroyRef).onDestroy(() => { console.log('UserProfile destruction'); }); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Custom Validator Factory Function in Angular (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Defines a custom synchronous validator factory function `forbiddenNameValidator`. This factory accepts a `RegExp` parameter (`nameRe`) and returns a `ValidatorFn`. The returned validator function takes an `AbstractControl` and checks if its value matches the forbidden pattern specified by the regex. If the name is forbidden (test passes), it returns an error object `{ 'forbiddenName': { value: control.value } }`; otherwise (if valid or control has no value), it returns `null`. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/form-validation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` /** A actor's name can't match the given regular expression */ export function forbiddenNameValidator(nameRe: RegExp): ValidatorFn { return (control: AbstractControl): ValidationErrors | null => { const forbidden = nameRe.test(control.value); return forbidden ? {forbiddenName: {value: control.value}} : null; }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Transforming Input Values in Angular DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using a `transform` function with the `@Input` decorator to modify an input's value. The `trimString` function trims a string input before setting its value. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/inputs.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ts CODE: ``` @Component({ selector: 'custom-slider', ... }) export class CustomSlider { @Input({transform: trimString}) label = ''; } function trimString(value: string | undefined) { return value?.trim() ?? ''; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating an Injectable Service in Angular DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to create a Calculator service with the @Injectable decorator which makes it available throughout the application with providedIn: 'root'. The service contains a simple add method for calculating the sum of two numbers. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/introduction/essentials/dependency-injection.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import {Injectable} from '@angular/core'; @Injectable({providedIn: 'root'}) export class Calculator { add(x: number, y: number) { return x + y; } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TestBed Configuration for Component Testing DESCRIPTION: The configuration of TestBed for component testing, which declares the component to be tested. The TestBed's configureTestingModule method is used to set up the testing environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/testing/components-basics.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: TypeScript CODE: ``` TestBed.configureTestingModule({ declarations: [ BannerComponent ] }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a FormGroup in Angular Component - TypeScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a FormGroup instance in the Angular component. The FormGroup includes form controls for 'firstName' and 'lastName'. It illustrates the initialization of form controls within a component class. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/reactive-forms.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { FormGroup, FormControl } from '@angular/forms'; export class ProfileEditorComponent { profileForm = new FormGroup({ firstName: new FormControl(''), lastName: new FormControl('') }); onSubmit() { // TODO: Use EventEmitter with form value console.warn(this.profileForm.value); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using parallel Function for Simultaneous Property Reading in Angular Tests DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the parallel function to read multiple properties of a component simultaneously. It optimizes change detection checks and works similarly to Promise.all for parallel execution of asynchronous operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/testing/using-component-harnesses.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` it('reads properties in parallel', async () => { const checkboxHarness = loader.getHarness(MyCheckboxHarness); // Read the checked and intermediate properties simultaneously. const [checked, indeterminate] = await parallel(() => [ checkboxHarness.isChecked(), checkboxHarness.isIndeterminate() ]); expect(checked).toBe(false); expect(indeterminate).toBe(true); }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing FormsModule for NgModel Usage in Angular Component (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Shows how to import `FormsModule` from `@angular/forms` into the `imports` array of an Angular standalone component. Importing `FormsModule` is required to use the `ngModel` directive for two-way data binding in template-driven forms. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/directives/overview.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { FormsModule } from '@angular/forms'; // Import FormsModule // ... other imports @Component({ selector: 'app-root', standalone: true, imports: [ FormsModule, // Make NgModel available // ... other imports ], templateUrl: './app.component.html', styleUrls: ['./app.component.css'], }) export class AppComponent { // ... component logic containing property for ngModel } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Component with Service Dependency Implementation DESCRIPTION: Implements a WelcomeComponent that depends on an injected UserService to display personalized welcome messages, demonstrating component-service interaction. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/testing/components-scenarios.md#2025-04-23_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core'; import { UserService } from './user.service'; @Component({ selector: 'app-welcome', template: '

{{welcome}}

' }) export class WelcomeComponent implements OnInit { welcome = ''; constructor(private userService: UserService) { } ngOnInit(): void { this.welcome = this.userService.isLoggedIn ? 'Welcome, ' + this.userService.user.name : 'Please log in.'; } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing a Custom Validator Directive in Angular (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Provides the implementation details for the `ForbiddenValidatorDirective`. The directive implements the `Validator` interface, requiring a `validate` method. It accepts a forbidden name pattern (as a string) via an `@Input('appForbiddenName') forbiddenName` property, which defaults to an empty string. The `validate` method uses the `forbiddenNameValidator` factory function, converting the input string into a `RegExp` and passing it to the factory to perform the actual validation on the provided `AbstractControl`. It returns the result from the `forbiddenNameValidator`. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/form-validation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` export class ForbiddenValidatorDirective implements Validator { @Input('appForbiddenName') forbiddenName = ''; validate(control: AbstractControl): ValidationErrors | null { return this.forbiddenName ? forbiddenNameValidator(new RegExp(this.forbiddenName, 'i'))(control) : null; } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating and Updating Writable Signals - Angular TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create a writable signal using `signal()` and update its value with `.set` and `.update` functions. The snippet shows a counter signal being incremented. Angular signals require no specific dependencies but are used within reactive contexts, updating automatically as their dependencies change. Inputs include the initial counter value, and outputs are the updated values. Limitations include synchronous execution constraints. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/core/primitives/signals/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: TypeScript CODE: ``` const counter = signal(0); counter.set(2); counter.update(count => count + 1); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Component-level Service Provider for Isolated Editing Sessions in Angular DESCRIPTION: A component that uses a component-scoped service instance to manage an individual tax return editing session. This demonstrates how to create isolated state management for multiple concurrent editing sessions with component-level providers. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/di/hierarchical-dependency-injection.md#2025-04-22_snippet_47 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { Component, EventEmitter, Input, Output } from '@angular/core'; import { HeroTaxReturn } from './hero'; import { HeroTaxReturnService } from './hero-tax-return.service'; @Component({ selector: 'app-hero-tax-return', templateUrl: './hero-tax-return.component.html', styleUrls: [ './hero-tax-return.component.css' ], providers: [ HeroTaxReturnService ] }) export class HeroTaxReturnComponent { message = ''; @Output() close = new EventEmitter(); get taxReturn(): HeroTaxReturn { return this.heroTaxReturnService.taxReturn; } @Input() set taxReturn(htr: HeroTaxReturn) { this.heroTaxReturnService.taxReturn = htr; } private heroTaxReturnService = inject(HeroTaxReturnService); onCanceled() { this.flashMessage('Canceled'); this.heroTaxReturnService.restoreTaxReturn(); } onClose() { this.close.emit(); } onSaved() { this.flashMessage('Saved'); this.heroTaxReturnService.saveTaxReturn(); } flashMessage(msg: string) { this.message = msg; setTimeout(() => this.message = '', 500); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Cross-Validation to Reactive Forms in Angular DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to add a cross-field validator to a reactive form in Angular by passing it as the second argument when creating the FormGroup. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/form-validation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const actorForm = new FormGroup({ 'name': new FormControl(), 'role': new FormControl(), 'skill': new FormControl() }, { validators: unambiguousRoleValidator }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using @if Block for Conditional Rendering in Angular Templates DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a basic @if block that conditionally renders content when the expression evaluates to truthy. This example displays a paragraph when variable a is greater than b. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/templates/control-flow.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: angular-html CODE: ``` @if (a > b) {

{{a}} is greater than {{b}}

} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Event Handling in Angular Components DESCRIPTION: Shows how to handle user events using parentheses syntax and component methods. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/introduction/essentials/templates.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: angular-ts CODE: ``` @Component({ /*...*/ // Add an 'click' event handler that calls the `cancelSubscription` method. template: ``, }) export class UserProfile { /* ... */ cancelSubscription() { /* Your event handling code goes here. */ } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Injecting `TemplateRef` and `ViewContainerRef` into a Structural Directive (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic structure of the `SelectDirective` class after generation. It shows importing `TemplateRef` and `ViewContainerRef` from `@angular/core` and injecting them into the directive using the `inject` function. These dependencies are essential for a structural directive to access and manipulate the template (`TemplateRef`) and its rendering location (`ViewContainerRef`). SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/directives/structural-directives.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ts CODE: ``` import {Directive, TemplateRef, ViewContainerRef} from '@angular/core'; @Directive({ selector: '[select]', }) export class SelectDirective { private templateRef = inject(TemplateRef); private ViewContainerRef = inject(ViewContainerRef); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Angular Application Entry Point with i18n Support DESCRIPTION: Main TypeScript file that bootstraps the Angular application with internationalization support. It includes code to initialize the app with locale information and load translations. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/i18n/example.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import {bootstrapApplication} from '@angular/platform-browser'; import {AppComponent} from './app/app.component'; import {provideTranslations} from './i18n-providers'; bootstrapApplication(AppComponent, { providers: [ // Configures your application to use internationalization capabilities. provideTranslations(), ], }).catch((err) => console.error(err)); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Static Queries with @ViewChild in Angular Typescript DESCRIPTION: Here, the @ViewChild decorator is used with the static option set to true, which allows accessing the queried element earlier in the Angular component lifecycle, specifically within the ngOnInit method. Setting static to true is beneficial when the queried element is always present and not conditionally rendered, providing a deterministic initialization model. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/queries.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Component({ selector: 'custom-card', template: 'Visit sunny California!', }) export class CustomCard { @ViewChild(CustomCardHeader, {static: true}) header: CustomCardHeader; ngOnInit() { console.log(this.header.text); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Injecting Dependencies with the inject Function in Angular DESCRIPTION: The inject function retrieves a dependency from the current injection context. It can be used in class constructors, factory functions, or inside functional components. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/goldens/public-api/core/index.api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` export function inject(token: ProviderToken): T; export function inject(token: ProviderToken, options: InjectOptions & { optional?: false; }): T; export function inject(token: ProviderToken, options: InjectOptions): T | null; export function inject(token: HostAttributeToken): string; export function inject(token: HostAttributeToken, options: { optional: true; }): string | null; export function inject(token: HostAttributeToken, options: { optional: false; }): string; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Binding Input Aliases in Angular Templates DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates binding to an aliased input in an Angular template, using `sliderValue` as the alias for `value` in the `custom-slider` component. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/inputs.md#2025-04-22_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: angular-html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building a FormRecord with FormBuilder in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a `FormRecord` using the `FormBuilder` service. The `fb.record()` method takes an object where keys are the control names and values are their initial states, inferring the control types. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/typed-forms.md#2025-04-22_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` ```ts import { FormBuilder } from '@angular/forms'; // Assuming fb is an injected instance of FormBuilder const fb = new FormBuilder(); const addresses = fb.record({'Andrew': '2340 Folsom St'}); // addresses will be of type FormRecord> ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Component with External Template and CSS in Angular DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows a component that uses external template and CSS files instead of inline definitions. This approach requires special handling in tests with compileComponents() to load the external files asynchronously. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/testing/components-scenarios.md#2025-04-23_snippet_41 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Component({ selector: 'app-banner', templateUrl: './banner-external.component.html', styleUrls: ['./banner-external.component.css'] }) export class BannerComponent { title = 'Test Tour of Heroes'; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Composing Multiple Host Directives DESCRIPTION: This snippet showcases how to combine multiple behaviors by using host directives within directives themselves, allowing for the composition of more complex behaviors across reusable Angular components and directives. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/directives/directive-composition-api.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Directive({...}) export class Menu { } @Directive({...}) export class Tooltip { } // MenuWithTooltip can compose behaviors from multiple other directives @Directive({ hostDirectives: [Tooltip, Menu], }) export class MenuWithTooltip { } // CustomWidget can apply the already-composed behaviors from MenuWithTooltip @Directive({ hostDirectives: [MenuWithTooltip], }) export class SpecializedMenuWithTooltip { } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining a Route with Parameters DESCRIPTION: This example defines a route that includes a parameter, allowing for dynamic data retrieval based on the URL path. The 'UserProfile' component can utilize the passed 'id' parameter to fetch and display relevant data. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/routing/define-routes.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: angular-ts CODE: ``` import { Routes } from '@angular/router'; import { UserProfile } from './user-profile/user-profile; const routes: Routes = [ { path: 'user/:id', component: UserProfile } ]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Content Projection with ngProjectAs DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using ngProjectAs attribute to alias content for projection into specific ng-content placeholders. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/content-projection.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Basic Angular Routes (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to define an array of `Routes` using `@angular/router`. Each route object maps a URL `path` to a `component` to be rendered when the path is matched, and optionally sets the browser `title`. This `routes` array is typically registered with the `RouterModule`. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/routing/show-routes-with-outlets.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: angular-ts CODE: ``` import { Routes } from '@angular/router'; import { HomeComponent } from './home/home.component'; import { ProductsComponent } from './products/products.component'; const routes: Routes = [ { path: '', component: HomeComponent, title: 'Home Page' }, { path: 'products', component: ProductsComponent, title: 'Our Products' } ]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Including a Child Component in an Angular Parent Template DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript snippet demonstrates how to embed a child component (`UserComponent`) within the template of a parent component (`AppComponent`). It uses the child component's selector (``) in the `template` string and adds `UserComponent` to the `imports` array of the parent component's decorator to make it available for use. This is a fundamental pattern for component composition in Angular. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/tutorials/learn-angular/steps/3-composing-components/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ts CODE: ``` template: ``, imports: [UserComponent] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using a Custom Pipe in Angular Component Template (Angular TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use a custom pipe in an Angular component template. The component includes 'ReversePipe' in its imports array and applies the pipe via template binding. The 'word' variable is transformed with the 'reverse' pipe, demonstrating integration and inline use of custom pipes in the component's template. Requires the previously defined ReversePipe to be imported and registered. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/tutorials/learn-angular/steps/24-create-a-pipe/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: angular-ts CODE: ``` @Component({\n ...\n template: `Reverse Machine: {{ word | reverse }}`\n imports: [ReversePipe]\n})\n ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying with @ContentChild in Angular Typescript DESCRIPTION: The code demonstrates using @ContentChild to query for a single projected child component in Angular. This pattern is used to access a CustomToggle component within projected content in a CustomExpando component. The ngAfterContentInit lifecycle hook is crucial since the query result becomes available at this point. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/queries.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Component({ selector: 'custom-toggle', /*...*/ }) export class CustomToggle { text: string; } @Component({ selector: 'custom-expando', /*...*/ }) export class CustomExpando { @ContentChild(CustomToggle) toggle: CustomToggle; ngAfterContentInit() { console.log(this.toggle.text); } } @Component({ selector: 'user-profile', template: ` Show ` }) export class UserProfile { } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Signal Implementation with Shipping Options DESCRIPTION: Example of a component using regular signals to manage shipping options selection, highlighting potential issues when shipping options change. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/signals/linked-signal.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Component({/* ... */}) export class ShippingMethodPicker { shippingOptions: Signal = getShippingOptions(); // Select the first shipping option by default. selectedOption = signal(this.shippingOptions()[0]); changeShipping(newOptionIndex: number) { this.selectedOption.set(this.shippingOptions()[newOptionIndex]); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating FormArray Getter in Angular Component DESCRIPTION: Implementing a getter method to access the FormArray control from the parent form group. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/reactive-forms.md#2025-04-22_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` get aliases() { return this.profileForm.get('aliases') as FormArray; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Input Property with Transform Function DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use a transform function to modify input values before they are set. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/components/inputs.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Component({ selector: 'custom-slider', /*...*/ }) export class CustomSlider { label = input('', {transform: trimString}); } function trimString(value: string | undefined): string { return value?.trim() ?? ''; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Form Generation with FormBuilder DESCRIPTION: Using FormBuilder's group() method to create form controls with initial values SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/forms/reactive-forms.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` profileForm = this.fb.group({ firstName: [''], lastName: [''], address: this.fb.group({ street: [''], city: [''], state: [''], zip: [''] }) }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Host Directives to Angular Component DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates applying a host directive MenuBehavior to the host element of the AdminMenu component in Angular. It uses the hostDirectives property in the decorator to statically attach directives, which are initialized when the component is rendered. SOURCE: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/adev/src/content/guide/directives/directive-composition-api.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` @Component({ selector: 'admin-menu', template: 'admin-menu.html', hostDirectives: [MenuBehavior], }) export class AdminMenu { } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating a New Component with ReactiveFormsModule in Angular DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the use of the Angular CLI command to generate a new component and how to import ReactiveFormsModule, which is essential for using reactive forms in your Angular project. This module is added to the imports array of the component's module.
